content: People keep opening "Amsterdam + X" topics. As I am not ubiquitous, this seems more appropriate. Hi everybody!
Cool! I'm also in Amsterdam (UvA)
UvA student too here. Master of Logic programme
@Anne Baanen do we know if the Logical Verification at VU course is going to be a thing this year too? Last time I checked, they hadn't found a substitute yet

Welcome to the Zulip! Last time I asked, the plan is that Kristina Sojakova will teach both Logic and Modelling (for bachelor students, this spring) and Logical Verification (for master students, next fall). I won't be at the VU after this summer, so it seems we'll miss each other course-wise.
There are of course many non-course opportunities to meet each other, such as the informal Formal Seminar in January :)

Thanks! As a UvA Master student, I am assuming I should wait for next fall, too?

Is the informal Formal Seminar a VU initiative? Can UvA students join too?
It's a joint UU-VU initiative by @Johan Commelin and @Sander Dahmen: https://jcommelin.github.io/informal-formalization-seminar/ I don't think there are any restrictions on who can attend.

Stefano Volpe said:

Thanks! As a UvA Master student, I am assuming I should wait for next fall, too?

There might be a few courses offered by UvA in the meantime, I don't really know where to find this info. The plan is also to have a MasterMath course on formalizing mathematics, but it's taking a long time to set up so I don't know when you can expect to follow that.
I see. Thank you!

@Anne Baanen do you also happen to know in which block the Master course will take place? My January is a mess but even if I am not able to make it to Informal Formalization I'd love to take the course if possible.
Probably in the spring semester of 2025.

Anne Baanen said:

Welcome to the Zulip! Last time I asked, the plan is that Kristina Sojakova will teach both Logic and Modelling (for bachelor students, this spring) and Logical Verification (for master students, next fall). I won't be at the VU after this summer, so it seems we'll miss each other course-wise.

I seemed to understand from this message that it was supposed to be next fall? I could still make it if I attend the course right before graduation
Ooh, you are talking about a different master course. Ignore my message. I thought you meant the MasterMath course.
Oh we have information abut the MasterMath one too? That's great! elo.mastermath.nl only covers up to spring 2024, I believe. How will the two courses compare?

Stefano Volpe said:

How will the two courses compare?

Logical Verification at the VU is aimed at computer science, the MasterMath is aimed at mathematics. So the contents are quite different: LoVe has a lot of program semantics that math students wouldn't need to understand :)
Not in Academia currently, but I am also located in Utrecht. Maybe I can take an afternoon off every now and then to join the seminar :)
Please also see the announcement of the Informal Formalization Seminar!

Stefano Volpe said:

UvA student too here. Master of Logic programme

Cool! I'm not actually in Amsterdam anymore, but I'm a MoL graduate.

I don't know much about current courses, but, if you're interested in Lean and self-motivated enough (which I assume applies given you're in this Zulip), remember you have quite some freedom with individual projects during the programme. You could do such a project using Lean, so long as you find someone willing to supervise it (and I believe there's no strict requirement your supervisor is at affiliated with UVA, although that might've changed in past years)

You could do such a project using Lean, so long as you find someone willing to supervise it (and I believe there's no strict requirement your supervisor is at affiliated with UVA, although that might've changed in past years)

(FWIW, I think there's many people here at UvA willing to supervise Lean projects! Myself, @Malvin Gattinger , probably @Lenny Taelman in the Math department)
I’ll be here from tomorrow (08/05) to Monday (12/05) if anyone wants to meet up:)
